data.title: Leopold I, King of the Belgians (1790
data.meta_description: King Leopold was the uncle of both Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. His first marriage in 1816 was to Princess Charlotte, Victorias cousin, who died in childbirth in 1817. In 1830 he accepted the invitation from the newly independent Belgians to be their king. Here he is depicted in a dark green military coat. He was very close to Queen Victoria, had supported the Queen and her mother in the difficult days before her accession, and looked very sharp after the poor little baby when her father, the Duke of...
